[+1]: Crux deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker. Put a chain counter on up to one target artifact or nonbasic land. It loses all abilities except mana abilities as long as it has a chain counter on it.
[-2]: Discard a card. When you do, Crux deals damage equal to the discarded card's mana value to up to one target creature and you draw a card.
[-6]: Exile target red instant or sorcery card from your graveyard. Add {R}{R}{R}, then you get an emblem with “You may cast copies of the exiled card.”

cards.flavor: Crux, the only Elder to survive the fall, returned to Oldun after sensing the energy of the Elders' reawakening.
cards.name: Crux's Wrath
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact or land.
Flashback {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Cursed Claymore

cards.flavor: There's no need for pilgrims to fear the ocean's depths—the surface is really just as dangerous.
cards.name: Cutthroat Kallukah
cards.text:
Flash
Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, scry 1 and put a +1/+1 counter on Cutthroat Kallukah.

cards.name: Daggertooth Keelah
cards.text:
Flash
Daggertooth Keelah can't block unless it entered this turn.
{1}{B}, Exile a permanent card from your graveyard: Daggertooth Keelah gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.name: Deathcap Guardian
cards.text: When Deathcap Guardian enters, exile any number of permanent cards from your graveyard. When you do, put X +1/+1 counters on Deathcap Guardian and up to one target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards exiled this way.

cards.name: Decipher the Ley-Runes
cards.text:
You may choose this spell's targets at random. If you do, it costs {2} less to cast.
Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
Flashback {6}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: However many heads it has, you can safely assume it's better than one.
cards.name: Deepcavern Scyllia
cards.text:
Deepcavern Scyllia enters with X +1/+1 counters on it.
You may cast Deepcavern Scyllia from your graveyard by paying {3}{G} and exiling X other permanent cards from your graveyard rather than paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Dormant Slagheap
cards.text:
Defender
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Dormant Slagheap loses defender until end of turn. If that spell was cast from your graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Dormant Slagheap.

cards.flavor: When one Mokar calls, the rest answer.
cards.name: Drawn to Grandeur
cards.text:
Create a 1/1 white Human creature token, then put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
Flashback {5}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: Unfortunately, none of Darik's friends back at the tavern believed him.
cards.name: Dream Catcher
cards.text: When Dream Catcher enters, return target exiled card with flashback you own to your hand.

cards.flavor: Fulfilled or not, the important thing is that it was made.
cards.name: Dying Pledge
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature or exile two permanent cards from your graveyard.
Draw two cards.

cards.flavor: Far beneath the biting cold, old dreams fester.
cards.name: Elder Eras
cards.text:
Scry 3, then draw three cards.
If this spell's flashback cost was paid, take an extra turn after this one.
Flashback {7}{U}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Elder Soulblade

cards.flavor: Aspirants who leave the Rathomar take a piece of the Elderflame with them as a warm reminder of their heritage.
cards.name: Elderflame Pilgrims
cards.text:
When Elderflame Pilgrims enters, it deals 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Wander {5}{R} (You may cast this from the battlefield for its wander cost.)

cards.flavor: Sometimes the safest place to be is nowhere at all.
cards.name: Elsewhere Portal
cards.text: Exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Embrace the Cycle
cards.text:
{1}, Exile a permanent card from your graveyard: Surveil 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.)
{2}, Exile two permanent cards from your graveyard: Draw a card.
{5}, Exile five permanent cards from your graveyard: Exchange your hand and graveyard.

cards.flavor: The Mokar have an agreement with Rano: Protection in exchange for food.
cards.name: Encampment Sentinel
cards.text:
Vigilance
At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you've spent at least five mana to cast spells this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Encampment Sentinel.

cards.name: Enduring Loyalty
cards.text:
Return up to three target creature cards from graveyards to the battlefield under your control.
Flashback—{2}{B}{B}, Sacrifice three creatures. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: On a plane so cold, the caldera feels like a different world altogether.
cards.name: Erupt
cards.text:
Target creature gets +X/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: History repeats itself whether you've learned it or not.
cards.name: Eternal Echoes
cards.text: Exile up to two target artifacts, creatures, or lands you control, then return them to the battlefield under their owner's control. If any of those permanents are Ruins, they become creatures in addition to their other types until end of turn.

cards.name: Eternal Sentinel
cards.text:
Vigilance
Whenever an opponent attacks with three or more creatures, you may have Eternal Sentinel become an artifact creature until end of turn.
Spellcharge 3 (At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you've spent at least three mana to cast spells this turn, you may have this become an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Everpresent Rot
cards.text:
When Everpresent Rot enters, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token, surveil 1, then you gain 1 life. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.)
When one or more permanent cards leave your graveyard, return Everpresent Rot to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
“We've lived in the shadows of giants all our lives, but over the past year, those shadows have gradually started to feel... darker.”
—Dinak, Mokar shaman
cards.name: Evolving Wilds_OLD
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put up to two permanent cards from among them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. You may put land cards onto the battlefield tapped rather than your hand.
Flashback—{3}{G}, Tap an untapped Ruin you control. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Face of the Phoenix
cards.text:
Exile the top two cards of your library. You may play those cards until you next cast a spell from your hand.
Flashback {3}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Final Fate
cards.text:
Destroy target creature if its mana value is less than or equal to the amount of mana spent to cast this spell.
Flashback {X}{B}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: Lightning doesn't strike twice, but fire does.
cards.name: Firebolt
cards.text:
Firebolt deals 2 damage to any target.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Fluttering Boughs
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add {C}.
Spellcharge 4 (At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you've spent at least four mana to cast spells this turn, you may have this become a land creature until end of turn.)

cards.flavor:
“In memory of my darling wielder— I shall remain here, always.”
—Sword inscription
cards.name: Forebears' Blade
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and can't be blocked by more than one creature.
Equip {4}

cards.flavor: If there is safety in numbers, how dangerous is solitude?
cards.name: Forever Alone
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
Enchanted permanent can't attack, block, or wander.

cards.text:
When Forgemaster Dreadnought enters, create three Treasure tokens.
Spellcharge 9 (At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you've spent at least nine mana to cast spells this turn, you may have this become an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Forget Their Names
cards.text:
Choose target card in a graveyard other than a basic land. Search its owner's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with the same name as that card and exile them. You gain 1 life for each card exiled this way. That player draws a card for each card exiled from their hand this way.
Flashback {3}{B}

cards.name: Forgotten Cultivator
cards.text:
Whenever Forgotten Cultivator enters or attacks, mill three cards. Return a permanent card from among the milled cards to your hand.
Spellcharge 4 (At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you've spent at least four mana to cast spells this turn, you may have this become an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Fumebloom
cards.text:
{1}{B}, Exile two permanent cards from your graveyard: Choose one —
• Create two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.
• Exile the top card of target opponent's library. You may play that card for as long as it remains exiled, and mana of any type can be spent to cast it.

cards.flavor: Thirteen sword wounds. Seven arrows in the back. Two quick slices of the blade. One victory.
cards.name: Fury of the Rathomar
cards.text: Target creature you control gains double strike until end of turn. It deals damage equal to its power to each of up to two other targets.

cards.name: Galvanized Gargantuan
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast instant and sorcery spells, you may pay {X}, where X is that spell's mana value. If you do, copy that spell, and you may choose new targets for the copy.
Spellcharge 4 (At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you've spent at least four mana to cast spells this turn, you may have this become an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.text:
Menace
Whenever Gelthis deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card until Gelthis leaves the battlefield.
Spellcharge 4 (At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you've spent at least four mana to cast spells this turn, you may have this become an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Glacier Guardian
cards.text:
If you have more life than your starting life total, this spell costs {X} less to cast, where X is equal to the difference.
Trample
When Glacier Guardian enters, you may have it fight target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.flavor: “It's really not that hard— most of these paths have actually been laid out long before the Mokar took up residence here.”
cards.name: Gleaming Pathlighter
cards.text:
Lifelink
When Gleaming Pathlighter enters, exile up to one target card from a graveyard.

cards.flavor: “You see, these inscriptions actually tell the story of a peaceful people who once walked this land. They carved out valleys in the mountains and had a deep connection to their weapons.”
cards.name: Goldrune Scribe
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you've spent at least five mana to cast spells this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Goldrune Scribe.

cards.flavor: The undersea's demeanor shifts with the tides— calm and calculating one moment, brutal and overwhelming the next.

Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. If it's your turn, it gets -5/-5 until end of turn instead.

Enchant creature

cards.text:
Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature. If this spell's flashback cost was paid, it deals that much damage to target player instead.

{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.text:
Flash

Equipped creature get +4/+0.

cards.text: As an additional cost to cast creature spells, you may pay {X}, where X is Heartbonder's power. When you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Heartbonder.

cards.flavor: Live every day in the bitter cold, and every sunrise feels like summer.

Lifelink

Flying

cards.flavor:
“My great-great-grandfather saw a vision in the flames of a peaceful people's extinction, and since then the Rathomar have only known war.”
—Jorgen, martyr of the Rathomar

cards.text:
Exile the top card of your library. You may play that card this turn.

cards.text:
{X}{R}: Jorgen gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

Lead and Follow

cards.flavor: One Aspirant stronghold was founded where all of Oldun's leylines converge, providing access to powerful magic.

cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color. If you have at least 3 life more than your starting life total, add two mana in any combination of colors instead.

Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. If you revealed a land this way, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor:
“I never got anywhere in life until I accepted who I was and what I wanted.”
—Jens Slopeskidder

cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
Wander {2}{W} (You may cast this from the battlefield for its wander cost.)

Create a 2/2 blue Drake creature token with flying.

cards.flavor:
“To my darling Nerul, I leave you a memory, a melody, and a message.”
—Alrantan statue inscription

cards.text:
Put any number of target noncreature cards from your graveyard on top of your library in any order.

cards.flavor:
“Before the giants fell, Alranta walked the world.”
—Alrantan folk tale
cards.name: Mammoth Undertaking
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample and “Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, return target permanent card with mana value less than or equal to the damage dealt from your graveyard to your hand.”

cards.flavor: Nadzi knew she would likely never return to the Mokar, but she had a hunch that this Thoveus had something to do with the Elders' reawakening.

cards.text: You lose life equal to the number of cards you've drawn this turn, then draw a card. You may repeat this process any number of times.

Mass of Remains's power is equal to the total number of permanent cards you own in your graveyard and in exile.

cards.flavor:
“I don't get the sense these Elders were such bad folks, really... Look at all the art and culture they left behind.”
—Tiv Kadar, Alrantan archaeologist

cards.text:

cards.flavor: The Mokar don't believe in a harsh training regimen for new recruits— with the bitter cold and weekly Rathomar raids, they get enough of that already.

cards.text:

Flying

cards.text:

cards.flavor:
“Burn the bodies. Collapse the caverns. These Aspirants think there's some truth hidden behind the Elders, but all I see is a bunch of dead men with giant swords.”
